concept.title: Local FS
concept.shortdesc: Use the Local FS destination to write records to files in a local file system.

conbody.p: Local FS destinationoverviewdestinationsLocal FSWhen you configure a Local FS destination, you define the output directory template. Local FS creates output directories based on the template and the time basis. Local FS writes records to the directories based on the time basis as well.
You can specify the amount of time that a record can be written to its associated directory and what happens to late records.
You can also use record header attributes to perform record-based writes. For more information, see .
You can use Gzip, Bzip2, Snappy, LZ4, and other compression formats to write output files.
